node.statement: (UV divergence analysis) As eps -> 0: (a) Cubic term: integral psi_eps :phi_eps^3: dx -> integral psi :phi^3: dx converges (psi is a smooth test function, :phi^3: is a distribution in C^{-3/2-delta} for d=3, and smooth test functions pair well with this regularity). (b) Quadratic term: integral psi_eps^2 :phi_eps^2: dx -> integral psi^2 :phi^2: dx converges similarly (:phi^2: in C^{-1-delta}). (c) Linear term: <psi_eps^3, phi_eps> -> <psi^3, phi> converges, but 2 delta_m_eps^2 <psi_eps, phi_eps> -> infinity since delta_m_eps^2 ~ lambda^2 log(1/eps). (d) Constants: lambda ||psi||_4^4 and delta_m_eps^2 ||psi||_2^2 (the latter diverges but is absorbed into normalization). Conclusion: the only UV-divergent field-dependent contribution is the linear term 2 delta_m_eps^2 <psi, phi>.
